intro: Phlox × longiflora, commonly known as the garden phlox, is a hybrid perennial plant native to North America. It is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit and vibrant clusters of showy, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink, red, white, or purple. The plant typically reaches heights of 1 to 3 feet and produces fragrant, five-petaled blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage is dark green and often has a slightly fuzzy texture, adding visual interest throughout the growing season. Phlox × longiflora thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
